about.about: The surface is the darkest among Uranian moons, and appears to have been shaped primarily by impacts. Umbriel is the second most heavily cratered satellite of Uranus after Oberon. The most prominent surface feature is a ring of bright material on the floor of Wunda crater.
about.discovery: Umbriel, along with another Uranian satellite, Ariel, was discovered by William Lassell on October 24, 1851.
about.name: Umbriel is the 'dusky melancholy sprite' in Alexander Pope's The Rape of the Lock.
